result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M. Malach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sean M. Malach is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sean M. Malach was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Sean M. Malach was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: $831.00 paid through DOR applied towards restitution in case 11CF23, but the  DA office advised that only $81.00 remained owing for an uncharged charge and the balance of the restitution in case 11CF23 was paid in full through Joint & Several.   $831.00 - $81.00 (11CF23) = $750.00 applied to 15CM123 restitution.

records.addlTxt: 10:35 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Sean M. Malach not in court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states that he received a letter from jail administrator Greenwood stating DE worked 600 hours for jail and is requesting 26.8 days credit.  So ordered.

Current: W3340 Hwy 182, Park Falls, WI 54552 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2016)
Prior: 415 State Rd  Lot 6, Rib Lake, WI 54470 United States

11:01 am - Defendant Sean M. Malach appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA certifies victims rights compliance. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Cts. 1 & 3.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Cts. 1 & 3 and on motion of DA dismisses Cts. 2 & 4. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:22 am.
Court imposes:
Ct. 1 - 45 day jail term, with huber privileges, cs to any other sentence; $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS; Restitution of $1701.38 + 10% surcharge
Ct. 3 - 45 day jail term, with huber privileges, cs to any other sentence; $243 court costs
30 days to pay from release or CO.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Terrence Mason, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant Sean M. Malach appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
